description.narrative: By the end of 2017, the rate of exclusive breastfeeding (0-6 months) has increased by 22 points and 30% of children aged 6-23 months in particular those from disadvantaged areas, receive acceptable food of supplementation through the adoption by households of Essential Family Practises of nutrition and at least 80% of severe acute malnourished children are screened and receive quality care in health facilities and communities including in emergency situations., which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, infant and maternal malnutrition is reduced to the most vulnerable and households adopt favorable behaviors to good nutrition and food hygiene

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2017, the rate of exclusive breastfeeding (0-6 months) has increased by 22 points and 30% of children aged 6-23months in particular those from disadvantaged areas, receive acceptable food of supplementation through the adoption by householdsof Essential Family Practises of nutrition and at least 80% of severe acute malnourished children are screened and receive qualitycare in health facilities and communities including in emergency situations.

description.narrative: regarding the MICS 2016 the stunting prevalence remains high (32.4%) with some regions that present prevalence surrounding the emergency threshold. However, the rate of exclusive breastfeeding has greatly increased for about 66% from 25.6% to 35.2%, although adequate complementary feeding remained quite bad around 2% | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2017
